Granting Access Rights for Promotion States

Each view has its own set of promotion states. You can grant users or groups rights at the project level for all promotion states in all views in the project or rights at the view level for the promotion states in a specific view. In both cases, promotion state rights are specified by the settings selected on the View and Promotion State nodes.

The access rights that affect promotion states are:

  • The right to define the promotion model.  A user who has been granted this right can perform the following operations:

    • Create and delete (promotion) states.

    • Edit the properties of these states.

    • Promote a label from one state to another. (Anyone who can edit promotion state properties can also promote the state.)

    • Reorder the states within the view.

    This right is set on the View node of the Project or the View Access Rights dialog.

  • Rights that govern access to individual promotion states. See below for a list of these rights.

    • These rights are set on the Promotion State node of the Project or View Access Rights dialogs. If you create a new promotion state, they must be set directly for that state. To do this, select View > Promotion to display the Promotion dialog, select the promotion state, click the Rights button, and select the appropriate rights.

Rights for an individual promotion state are initially checked at the state level. If necessary, the checking continues at the view level and eventually the project level. If a user is granted a specific right at one level, there is no need to check the next level.

  • When a right is granted at the view level, it applies to all the states in the view, unless access is denied at the state level.

  • When a right is granted at the project level, it applies to all the states in all views within the project, unless access is denied at the state or view levels.

To set promotion state rights for all views or for a particular view:

  1. Open the view.

  2. Select Project > Access Rights or View > Access Rights from the StarTeam client menu. This action displays the Project or View Access Rights dialog.

  3. Select the View node.

  4. Click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights to dialog opens.

  5. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  6. Select the Grant option button.

  7. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  8. On the right pane, from the View specific rights category, select the right to Define promotional model.

  9. Select the Promotion State node.

  10. Click Add.

  11. Select the same user or group.

  12. Select the Grant button.

  13. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  14. On the right pane, from the Generic object rights category, grant the right to Change object access rights. From the Promotion state specific rights category, grant the right to Modify label assignment.

  15. Click OK. The user or group now has the access rights necessary to control promotion states.

Promotion State Access Rights

Change object access rights

Change the access rights for an individual promotion state. If you alter this setting, be sure that your name remains on the list of users who can change access rights. This right is a generic object right. After creating a new promotion state, you must exist and re-enter the Promotion dialog if you want to set access rights for the newly created state.

Modify label assignment

Change the label assigned to an individual state either by clicking the Promote button or editing the label property. No other properties for the state can be edited unless the user also has the Define promotion model access right available from the View node. This right is a promotion-state specific right.
